title: Question: Booting WIN/WES 7 from USB with BitLocker

forumNotes.author: petraos77
forumNotes.content:
Have anyone tried to do it ?  

I had installed WIN \& WES 7 on usb and booted from it. And when I tried to add BitLocker to it, windows said I should set up 2 partitions.  
So now I working on creating a bootable WIN/WES 7 USB with 2 partitions. And just wanted to hear others opinion on this subject.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
what is WES? Are you using a USB HDD or Flash?  

If you have a working USB then maybe  

1. Use ImageX to make a copy of it (that way you always have a working image to restore if anything goes wrong)  
2. Wipe disk and create two new NTFS ptns  
3. ImageX the image onto 2nd ptn  
4. Run bcdboot onto the first ptnso it makes the first ptn bootable as a boot ptn  
5. Boot Win 7 and convert to bitlocker (if it will let you!)
